ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d package

Submodules

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.camera module

Module that implements stereo camera related classes and methods.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.camera.StereoCamera(intrinsics: Tuple[float, float, float, float], size: Tuple[int, int])[source]

Bases: object

Abstracts some properties and methods related to the StereoCamera.

intrinsics_matrix

the instrinsics matrix values (fx, fy, cx, cy).

Type:

np.ndarray

intrinsics_matrix_inv

the inverse intrinsics matrix.

Type:

np.ndarray

size

containing the image size (width, height)

Type:

a tuple (int, int)

Initializes the stereo camera.

Parameters:

  • intrinsecs (a tuple [float, float, float, float]) – the four stereo camera intrinsics values ([fx, fy, cx, cy]).

  • size (tuple [int, int]) – the image size (width, height)

get_2d_point(p_3d: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Gets the 2D point in the image reference frame.

Uses the equation p_2d = 1/z*(K @ p_3d), where p_2d is the 2D point vector (in homogenenous coordinates), z is the depth information, K is the intrinsics matrix and p_3d is the 3D point vector. p_2d is in homogeneous coordinates, but p_3d is not. The scalar 1/z makes the operation correct.

The depth information can be ignored, as the z coordinate can be equivalently assumed to be 1 as the equation above shows.

Parameters:

p_3d (np.ndarray) – the 3D point in homogeneous coordinates ([x, y, z, w]).

get_3d_point(p_2d: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], depth: float) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Gets the 3D points in the camera reference frame.

Uses the equation p_3d = z*(K_inv @ p_2d), where p_3d is the 3D point vector, z is the depth information, K_inv the inverse intrinsics matrix and p_2d is the 2D point vector (in homogeneous coordinates). p_2d is in homogeneous coordinates, but p_3d is not. The scalar z makes the operation correct.

Parameters:

  • p_2d (np.ndarray) – the 2D point in homogeneous coordinates ([x, y, 1]).

  • depth (float) – the depth information related to the 2D point.

load_image(image_path: str) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Loads a single image using the PIL library.

Has the purpose of avoiding explicit loading in main programs.

Parameters:

image_path (str) – the path to the image.

Returns:

data (np.ndarray) – the data from the image.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.crop module

This module contains the class that represents a 3D corn crop.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.crop.CornCrop(camera: StereoCamera, depth_img: Image, crop_mask: Mask, crop_box: Box, depth_neighbors: int | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Abstraction of a 3D agricultural corn crop.

crop_mask

the 2D mask that represents this crop.

Type:

features_2d.masks.Mask

crop_box

the 2D box that represents this crop.

Type:

features_2d.boxes.Box

ps_3d

the 3D corn crop points.

Type:

np.ndarray

average_point

the 3D average point that describes the crop position.

Type:

np.ndarray

crop_vector

the 3D vector that describes the crop orientation.

Type:

np.ndarray

crop_vector_angles

the theta and phi angles that describes the vector orientation in the 3D space.

Type:

np.ndarray

emerging_point

the 3D point where the crop intercepts the ground plane.

Type:

np.ndarray

filter_data

the histogram and bins values obtained from the depth filtering.

Type:

list

estimated_motion_2d

the 2D estimated motion of this crop considering extrinsics information from the moment that this is constructed and the next moment.

Type:

a tuple [float, float]

cluster

the cluster number that this crop belongs to.

Type:

int

Find the 3D corn crop points.

Construct the 2D points and the masked depth image to calculate the 3D points.

TODO: visualize data from depth filtering TODO: clean _get_vector_angles method

Parameters:

  • camera (features_3d.camera.StereoCamera) – the object that contains all the stereo camera information to obtain the 3D crop.

  • depth_img (PIL.Image) – the depth img from the whole scene. It will be masked in this method.

  • crop_mask (features_2d.masks.Mask) – the object that contains the crop 2D mask to obtain the 3D crop.

  • crop_box (features_2d.boxes.Box) – the object that contains the crop 2D box to do tracking.

  • depth_neighbors (int, optional) – a value containing the accepted number of neighbors to the most frequent depth. For more reference, please see documentation for ‘_filter_crop_depth()’ method. If it is not provided, the depth is not filtered.

_filter_crop_depth(masked_depth: Image, depth_neighbors: float = 2, size_bins: int = 500) → Tuple[Image, _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]][source]

Filters the depth image with a distance occurence approach.

Take the most frequent distance and its ‘depth_neighbors’ neighbors as the depth of the crop. The distance is clipped to the bottom and upper neighbors.

Parameters:

  • masked_depth (PIL.Image) – the object containing the crop masked depth information.

  • depth_neighbors (int, optional) – indicates how many neighbors will be considered to filter the depth.

  • size_bins (int, optional) – contains the size of the histogram bins.

Returns:

  • filtered_depth (PIL.Image) – the filtered depth information.

  • histogram_values (np.ndarray) – the histogram values (size i).

  • histogram_bins (np.ndarray) – the histogram bins values (size i + 1).

_get_principal_component(data_3d: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Get the principal component vector from crop 3D points.

Parameters:

data_3d (np.ndarray) – the crop’s 3D points.

Returns:

main_component (np.ndarray) – the principal component vector.

_get_vector_angles(vector: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Get theta and phi angles representing vector orientation in 3D space.

The angle theta is the angle between the Z axis and the vector. The angle phi is the angle between the x axis and the projection of the vector into the XY plane.

Parameters:

vector (np.ndarray) – the vector coordinates.

Returns:

angles (np.ndarray) – the theta and phi values, respectively.

downsample(voxel_size: float) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Downsample the 3D point cloud using the voxel grid method.

The downsampled point cloud is stored in the class attribute ‘ps_3d’.

Parameters:

voxel_size (float) – the voxel size.

Returns:

downsampled_data (np.ndarray) – the downsampled 3D point cloud.

find_emerging_point(ground_plane: GroundPlane) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Finds the crop’s emerging point.

The emerging point is obtained by calculating the interception point between the crop and the ground plane.

Parameters:

ground_plane (features_3d.ground_plane.GroundPlane) – ground plane object.

Returns:

emerging_point (np.ndarray) – the emerging point.

plot(data_plot: List | None = None, plot_3d_points: bool = False, line_scalars: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes] | None = None, plot_emerging_point: bool = False, cluster_blacklist: List | None = None) → List[source]

Plot the corn crop using Plotly library.

Parameters:

  • data_plot (list, optional) – all the previous plotted objects. If it is not informed, a empty list is created and data is appended to it.

  • plot_3d_points (bool, optional) – indicates if the crop 3D pointcloud needs to be plotted.

  • line_scalars (np.ndarray) – contains the desired scalars to plot the crop line. If it is not informed, the line is not plotted.

  • plot_emerging_point (bool, optional) – indicates if the crop 3D emerging point needs to be plotted.

  • cluster_blacklist (list) – the clusters that must be filtered.

Returns:

data (list) – the list of all plotted objects.

plot_depth_histogram(rgb_img: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], depth_img: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → None[source]

Plot the crop depth histogram used for filtering.

Parameters:

  • rgb_img (np.ndarray) – the RGB image. Used only for visualization.

  • depth_img (np.ndarray) – the depth image. Used only for visualization.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.crop.CornCropGroup(detection_group: DetectionGroup, camera: StereoCamera, depth_img: Image, depth_neighbors: int | None = None, ground_plane: GroundPlane | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Abstraction of a group of 3D agricultural corn crops.

crops

a list containing the features_3d.crop.CornCrop objects.

Type:

list

Initializes a corn crop group.

Parameters:

  • mask_group (features_2d.detection.DetectionGroup) – the object containing all the crops masks.

  • camera (features_3d.camera.StereoCamera) – It contains all the stereo camera information to obtain the 3D crops.

  • depth_img (PIL.Image) – the object containing the depth img from the whole scene. It will be masked in this method.

  • depth_neighbors (int, optional) – the amount of neighbors considered to filter the depth data. For more reference, please see documentation for features_3d.masks.CornCrop._filter_crop_depth() method. If it is not provided, the depth is not filtered.

  • ground_plane (features_3d.ground_plane.GroundPlane, optional) – It contains all the ground plane features. If it is not informed, the crops’ emerging point is not calculated.

downsample(factor: int) → None[source]

Downsample the corn crops.

Parameters:

factor (int) – the downsampling factor.

  • line_scalars (np.ndarray, optional) – the desired scalars to plot the crop line. If it is not informed, the line is not plotted.

  • plot_emerging_point (bool, optional) – indicates if the crop 3D emerging point needs to be plotted.

  • cluster_blacklist (list, optional) – the clusters that must be ignored.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.ground_plane module

This module contains the GroundPlane class that is used to find the ground

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.ground_plane.GroundPlane(rgb_img: Image, finding_ground_method: str, camera: StereoCamera, depth_img: Image, threshold_values: Dict | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Abstraction of a 3D agricultural corn ground plane.

rgb_img

the scene RGB image.

Type:

PIL.Image

hsv_img

the scene HSV image.

Type:

np.ndarray

binary_mask

the binary mask.

Type:

np.ndarray

ground_vectors

two vectors that describes the ground plane.

Type:

np.ndarray

normal_vector

the normal vector of the ground plane.

Type:

np.ndarray

coeficients

the plane equation coeficients. The equation used is ax + by + cz + d = 0.

Type:

np.ndarray

Initializes the ground plane abstraction.

TODO: Add more documentation about the threshold_values dictionary. TODO: refactor this to share some 3D methods with CornCrop

Parameters:

  • rgb_img (PIL.Image) – the scene RGB image.

  • finding_ground_method (str) –

    the type of ground finding method that will be used. The possible methods are:

    1. ‘threshold_gaussian’: converts the RGB to the HSV color space and applies a Gaussian filter and color thresholds to find the ground.

    2. ‘ngrdi’: uses the NGRDI vegetation index to find the ground.

  • camera (features_3d.camera.StereoCamera) – the object contains all the stereo camera information to obtain the 3D crop.

  • depth_img (PIL.Image) – the depth img from the whole scene. It will be masked in this method.

  • threshold_values (dict [str, float]) – the threshold values if the choosen method is ‘threshold_gaussian’. If it is not provided, default values are used. For more reference, please refer to source.

_get_plane_coefficients(normal_vector: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], point: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → List[source]

Calculate the plane coefficients from the normal vector and a point.

The plane equation considered is ax + by + cz + d = 0.

Parameters:

  • normal_vector (np.ndarray) – the ground plane normal vector

  • point (np.ndarray) – a point of the ground plane.

Returns:

coefs (list) – the plane coefficients in the order: a, b, c, d.

_get_principal_components(data_3d: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Get the two principal component vector from crop 3D points.

Parameters:

data_3d (np.ndarray) – the crop’s 3D points.

Returns:

components (np.ndarray) – the two principal components.

evaluate_at_determined_x_z(x: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], z: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → Tuple[_SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]][source]

get_ngrdi_mask(rgb_img: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Parameters:

Returns:

mask (np.ndarray) – the image with the calculated NGRDI metric.

get_threshold_gaussian_mask(hsv_img: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], threshold_values: Dict) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Applies the ‘threshold_gaussian’ method to find the ground mask.

Parameters:

  • hsv_img (np.ndarray) – the scene image in the HSV color space.

  • threshold_values (dict [str, float]]) – the threshold values if the choosen method is ‘threshold_gaussian’. If it is not provided, default values are used. For more reference, please refer to source.

Returns:

mask (np.ndarray) – the mask with the ground pixels.

plot(data_plot: List | None = None, plot_3d_points: bool = False, plot_plan_scalars: Tuple[_SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]] | None = None) → List[source]

Plot the corn crop using Plotly library.

Parameters:

  • data_plot (list, optional) – the previous plotted objects. If it is not informed, a empty list is created and data is appended to it.

  • plot_3d_points (bool, optional) – a boolean that indicates if the ground plane 3D pointcloud needs to be plotted.

  • plot_plan_scalars (a tuple [np.ndarray, np.ndarray], optional) – two Numpy arrays with scalars to plot the plan. The first Numpy array must contain scalars for X coordinates and the second must contain scalars for Z coordinates. If it is not provided, the plan is not plotted.

Returns:

data (list) – the list of plotted objects.

tune_values_tool() → None[source]

Implements a tool to tune values for ground plane finding.

Uses the OpenCV library to do filtering and to open trackbars. The ‘threshold_gaussian’ option needs to be specified in the class constructor.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.scene module

Encapsules a agricultural scene with 3D crops and ground plane.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.scene.AgriculturalScene(crop_group: CornCropGroup, ground_plane: GroundPlane, extrinsics: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes] | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Abstracts a agriculture scene.

A agricultural scene containing 3D crops and ground plane. It is obtained from a RGB and a depth images.

crop_group

object that encapsules the information about all the crops in a single scene.

Type:

features_3d.crop.CornCropGroup

ground_plane

the object that contains all the ground plane features.

Type:

features_3d.ground_plane.GroundPlane

extrinsics

the extrinsics matrix. It can be applied to all agricultural scene components. If it is not informed, the add_extrinsics_information function must be called.

Type:

np.ndarray

age

the age of the scene. It is used to remove old scenes from the sequence.

Type:

int

_apply_extrinsics_to_3D_vector(vector_3d: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], extrinsics: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Applies the extrinsics matrix to a 3D vector.

Parameters:

  • vector_3d (np.ndarray) – the 3D vector. It will be transformed in homogeneous coordinate to apply the extrinsics.

  • extrinsics (np.ndarray) – the extrinsics matrix. It describes the transformation from the camera frame to a global frame.

Returns:

euclidian_vector (np.ndarray) – the 3D vector in the Euclidian coordinates.

add_extrinsics_information(pos_world_body: List, orient_world_body: List, pos_camera_body: List, orient_camera_body: List) → None[source]

Adds extrinsics information to the scene.

Updates the crops and ground plane 3D points and their’s describing features (average points and vectors).

TODO: crop and ground plane calculation are done before and after

adding extrinsics. Refactor constructors to spare computational power.

Parameters:

  • pos_world_body (list) – a list containing three floats describing translation in the x, y and z axis from the world frame to the body frame.

  • orient_world_body (list) – a list containing four floats describing the quaternion rotation from the world frame to the body frame.

  • pos_camera_body (list) – a list containing three floats describing translation in the x, y and z axis from the camera frame to the body frame.

  • orient_camera_body (list) – a list containing four floats describing the quaternion rotation from the camera frame to the body frame.

downsample(crop_voxel_size: float, ground_plane_voxel_size: float) → None[source]

Downsamples the scene pointclouds with the voxel grid method.

Parameters:

  • crop_voxel_size (float) – the voxel size to be used in the crop pointcloud. If it is None, the crop pointcloud will not be downsampled.

  • ground_plane_voxel_size (float) – the voxel size to be used in the ground plane pointcloud. If it is None, the ground plane pointcloud will not be downsampled.

get_transformation_matrix(translation: List, rotation: List) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Gets the transformation matrix from translation and rotation values.

Parameters:

  • translation (list) – a list containing three floats describing the desired translation in the x, y and z axis.

  • rotation (list) – a list containing four floats describing the quaternion rotation.

Returns:

transformation_matrix (np.ndarray) – the transformation matrix in homogeneous coordinates.

plot(data_plot: List | None = None, line_scalars: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes] | None = None, plane_scalars: Tuple[_SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]] | None = None, plot_3d_points_crop: bool = False, plot_3d_points_plane: bool = False, plot_emerging_points: bool = False, cluster_blacklist: List | None = None)[source]

Plot the agricultural scene using the Plotly library.

Parameters:

  • data_plot (list, optional) – the previous plotted objects. If it is not informed, a empty list is created and data is appended to it.

  • line_scalars (np.ndarray, optional) – the desired scalars to plot the crop line. If it is not informed, the line is not plotted.

  • plane_scalars (a tuple [np.ndarray, np.ndarray], optional) – The first Numpy array must contain scalars for X coordinates and the second must contain scalars for Z coordinates. If it is not provided, the plan is not plotted.

  • plot_3d_points_crop (bool, optional) – indicates if the crop 3D pointclouds needs to be plotted.

  • plot_3d_points_plane (bool, optional) – indicates if the ground plane 3D pointclouds needs to be plotted.

  • plot_emerging_point (bool, optional) – indicates if the crop 3D emerging point needs to be plotted.

  • cluster_blacklist (list, optional) – a list containing the clusters that must be ignored.

Returns:

:obj:`list` – the plotted objects.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.sequence module

Encapsules several agricultural scenes through time.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.features_3d.sequence.AgriculturalSequence(scenes: List | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Abstracts a agriculture sequence.

scenes

a list of features_3d.scene.AgriculturalScene objects containing all the information from each scene in the sequence.

Type:

list

Initializes the agricultural sequence.

Parameters:

scenes (list) – a list of features_3d.scene.AgriculturalScene objects containing all the information from each scene in the sequence. If it is None, a empty list is initialzed.

Adds a scene to this sequence.

cluster_crops(eps: float = 0.05, min_samples: int = 3) → List[source]

Fits a unsupervised model to crop data to try to approximate stems.

TODO: Save computational power by saving the last seen scene index.

Parameters:

  • eps (float, optional) – the maximum distance between two samples for one to be considered as in the neighborhood of the other.

  • min_samples (int, optional) – the number of samples (or total weight) in a neighborhood for a point to be considered as a core point. This includes the point itself.

Returns:

crop_labels (list) – containing the labels of the analysed crops.

plot(data_plot: List | None = None, line_scalars: _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes] | None = None, plane_scalars: Tuple[_SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]] | None = None, plot_3d_points_crop: bool = False, plot_3d_points_plane: bool = False, plot_emerging_points: bool = False, cluster_threshold: int = 3) → List[source]

Plot the agricultural sequence using the Plotly library.

Parameters:

  • data_plot (list, optional) – a list containing all the previous plotted objects. If it is not informed, a empty list is created and data is appended to it.

  • line_scalars – (np.ndarray, optional) the desired scalars to plot the crop line. If it is not informed, the line is not plotted.

  • plane_scalars – (tuple of [np.ndarray, np.ndarray], optional): the scalars to plot the plan. The first tuple array must contain scalars for X coordinates and the second must contain scalars for Z coordinates. If it is not provided, the plan is not plotted.

  • plot_3d_points_crop (bool, optional) – indicates if the crop 3D pointclouds needs to be plotted.

  • plot_3d_points_plane (bool, optional) – indicates if the ground plane 3D pointclouds needs to be plotted.

  • plot_emerging_point (bool, optional) – indicates if the crop 3D emerging point needs to be plotted.

  • cluster_threshold (int, optional) – indicates how many occurences a cluster must have to be printed.

Returns:

data_plot (list) – a list containing all the plotted objects.
